content:
The information is organized as follows:

1. Key clients:
* Theresa Van Den Eeden, Industry Segments Marketing Manager – Critical Infrastructure
* Viktoria Jildenkrans, Global Enterprise Segment Marketing Manager
* Joe Morgan, Segment Development Manager - Critical Infrastructure-Americas
2. Relationship with key clients: Good - this is a new account, first project KO in November 2022
3. Who to engage to expand engagement: Theresa and Viktoria
4. Status of input, umbrella, and creative briefs: In process
5. How the engagement was obtained: Lead through BD
6. Current state and scope/budget of engagement: $27,750.00
7. Assignment objectives:
* Develop new personas to be used as a foundation for creating demand gen nurtures, ads, and ABM (end of 2023)
* Move away from casting a wide net and be more specific with marketing efforts
* Long term goals include fine tuning personas and updating as a year after year project
8. Campaign idea:
* Starting with foundational project (persona development) then use this to evolve into content and overall marketing strategy
* Also working on media planning - could use support on this potentially after persona work
9. What is going well with the engagement: N/A
10. What needs to be improved: Messaging, they need more targeted marketing
11. Key activation strategies and tactics: N/A
12. What do we feel they need from Spear that they are not currently utilizing: Engagement began in November 2022, so TBD
13. Additional strategies, content and activations to recommend: Content updates, nurture strategy, nurture copywriting, paid ads (strategy, design/copy)
14. Content gaps/needs we can fill: TBD
15. Who to connect with to grow the engagement: Theresa, maybe Viktoria
16. CTA/Offers working well or need further development: Offers are currently generic, the personas we're developing will be used for more targeted CTA/Offers
17. Goals and Objectives:
* Company business objectives (quantitative and qualitative):
	+ Position Axis as not just cameras but focus on their sensors, creating features, apps, etc similar to the iPhone
	+ Become a part of the bigger picture with adaptation of AI
18. Target Audience:
* Primary and secondary target profiles/personas: Critical Infrastructure segment
* Emotional and rational decision drivers: N/A
* Most actionable insight influencing the purchase decision: N/A
19. Customer/Buyer Journey:
* Outline key steps in the buyer journey: Buyers purchase solutions through Channel Partners
* Who is involved in the decision process: N/A
* Key drivers at each stage of the process: N/A
20. Situation Overview:
* Business units: N/A
* Market dynamics: Business trends and market environment challenges: N/A
* SWOT:
	+ Strengths (differentiation): Axis developed the IP camera in early 2000s - they are the innovative pioneers in this space.
	+ Weaknesses and challenges: Currently casting a wide net instead of being specific with marketing efforts. Creating lots of noise and clutter in their marketing automation.
	+ Opportunities and growth drivers: They are ready to position themselves as operation efficiency experts hosting analytics, software on the edge. Opportunity in focusing on data insights their products provide customers
	+ Threats, barriers and obstacles: Getting a larger slice of the Axis pie since they’re selling through partners,
